elements.text:
Huntington's Disease Society of America (HDSA)

HDSA provides comprehensive support for individuals and families affected by Huntington’s disease through community services, education, advocacy, and research.

https://hdsa.org/



HDSA Centers of Excellence

Discover comprehensive care and support for HD at HDSA Centers of Excellence. Professionals in neurology, psychiatry, and more guide families through every stage of HD.

https://hdsa.org/find-help/clinical-care-services/hdsa-centers-of-excellence/



HDSA Helpline

The HDSA Helpline is operated by trained HD social workers. Available Monday – Friday, 9 a.m. – 5 p.m. EST. For support and guidance tailored to the challenges of HD families, contact the HDSA Helpline at 800-345-HDSA (4372).

https://hdsa.org/find-help/community-social-support/



HDSA Telehealth

HDSA's Telehealth Program offers free counseling sessions with licensed social workers and psychologists specializing in HD. Access sessions through www.hdsa.amwell.com or the Amwell® app using the Service Key HDSA. Each HD family member can schedule up to 8 visits per year.

https://hdsa.org/find-help/community-social-support/hdsa-telehealth/



HD Reach

HD Reach provides support for individuals affected by Huntington's Disease (HD) by troubleshooting challenges, connecting families to resources, assisting with long-term care options, and offering community support and education.

https://www.hdreach.org/



HDSA's Locate Resources Tool

Find help by clicking on 1 or more selection(s) to find services and providers in your area. Options include physicians, physical therapists, legal resources, speech therapists, and more.

https://hdsa.org/about-hdsa/locate-resources/
